page.title: 01SURVEY OF CAREW AREA,TENBY.
page.content: The area is predominately lowland, rising to 90m in the S.W. corner. Skirting the S.boundary{'The Ridgeway' runs from{Tenby}in the E.to{Pembroke in the W.,and offers panoramic views overall.It is an area of scattered farms with the N.W.section containing the villages of{Milton,Carew,Carew {Cheriton}and{Sageston.Carew}and{Milton are situated on the upper reaches of the{Carew River,}which being part of the{Milford Haven}is tidal.Two buildings stand out_{Carew Castle}and {Carew Cheriton Church.}Coupled with the{French Mill}and{Celtic Cross}they offer tourist attractions.The farmland _mainly intensively managed grassland_ a caravan site and disused airfield are separated from the mainly residential area by the A477{Pembroke {Dock_Carmarthen}road.A designated area for residential and industrial growth.
